column4: i have a problem, any body want to try and tackle this with me?
you need to find what was the last file you were messing with
if you can find out for me what file it is you messed with I can help you a bit easier
i would shake your hand on that guess.
I know ubuntu once you set it up right doesn't give you any hassles
well, what you need to do now, is look for the backup you said you made of the .asoundrc file
its normally in your home folder
as soon as I get some things finished on my lappy, I'll be able to help others boost ubuntu up a bit
set nautilus to show hidden files
only thing I can suggest is to look thru all the folders you can remember going thru, but, this time, to find all the files in them, use xterm
it seems i made two files there.   asound.conf     and     asound.confg

those are the only files. and one is a lot larger then the other. also i don't know if i ned to rename it. and also what do i do to make it that one. (for example i am going to save both files on a flash drive. and then deploy one of them. (but i dont know what i would do
open them up and have a look, compare whats in them against the original .asoundrc
crap the files are .asound    so does this mean i still need to find asoundrc?
I would stay and help ya a bit more dude, but I have to go to work
when I get paid time and a half, I ain't complaining
